Name: Login/Registration Module of Labour Union Project
Desc: The labor union project develops a secure login/registration system using Java, Spring Boot, Hibernate, SQL, Kafka, Microservices, and J2EE. It features user interfaces for registration and login, backed by microservices handling authentication, user management, notifications, and audit logging. User data is stored securely in SQL databases using Hibernate. Kafka manages real-time messaging for notifications and logs. Security measures include HTTPS, JWT tokens, role-based access control, and data encryption. The system is containerized with Docker and orchestrated with Kubernetes for scalability and reliability, ensuring efficient and secure user management.

Name: Blog Application
Desc: The blog application project leverages Java, Spring Boot, Hibernate, SQL, Kafka, Microservices, and J2EE to create a robust platform for managing blog posts. It includes user interfaces for creating, editing, and viewing posts, supported by microservices for content management, user authentication, notifications, and audit logging. Hibernate manages data persistence in SQL databases. Kafka handles real-time notifications and data streaming. Security measures encompass HTTPS, JWT tokens, and role-based access control. The application is containerized with Docker and orchestrated using Kubernetes, ensuring scalability, reliability, and efficient blog management.
